title: Radio Operator
description:
Banco de Talentos – Operador(a) de Rádio Offshore

Local de Atuação:
 Unidades de perfuração/produção offshore (operações globais)

Escala:
 28x28 ou 21x21 (dependendo do projeto)

Departamento:
 Operações / Marinha

Reporta-se a:
 Offshore Installation Manager (OIM)


Visão Geral da Função

Buscamos profissionais para compor nosso Banco de Talentos de Operador(a) de Rádio Offshore . Você será responsável por garantir comunicações seguras, eficientes e em conformidade entre a instalação offshore, embarcações de apoio, helicópteros e times onshore. O(a) operador(a) também atua como ponto crucial durante situações de emergência, assegurando a coordenação rápida e precisa de todas as atividades de comunicação.


Principais Responsabilidades

  • Operar e monitorar todos os sistemas de rádio e telecomunicações (GMDSS, INMARSAT, AIS, etc.) de acordo com normas internacionais e requisitos de bandeira.
  • Manter contato contínuo com helicópteros, embarcações de suprimento, embarcações de segurança e logística em terra.
  • Garantir conformidade com os protocolos de comunicação marítima e aeronáutica definidos por IMO , ICAO e autoridades de bandeira.
  • Acompanhar e reportar condições meteorológicas relevantes à equipe a bordo.
  • Gerenciar operações de helicóptero:
    rastreamento de voos, atualização de manifestos e coordenação com equipes de aviação.
  • Atualizar o sistema de Pessoas a Bordo (POB) e enviar relatórios diários às partes interessadas em terra.
  • Manter registros de comunicação e documentação exigida para auditorias.
  • Atuar como oficial principal de comunicações em emergências, apoiando o OIM e o time de resposta.
  • Apoiar processos administrativos (ex.:
    Permissão de Trabalho) e tarefas gerais da sala de rádio.
  • Identificar falhas em sistemas de comunicação, registrar ocorrências e acionar manutenção.


Qualificações e Experiência

  • Certificação GMDSS válida.
  • Certificado STCW de Operador(a) de Rádio (se exigido pela bandeira).
  • BOSIET/FOET com CA-EBS.
  • Exame Médico Offshore (OGUK ou equivalente) válido.
  • Vivência prévia como Operador(a) de Rádio em ambientes offshore (perfuração, produção ou marítimo).
  • Familiaridade com sistemas de rastreamento de voos e gerenciamento de POB (Vantage, RigNet ou similares).
  • Inglês intermediário/avançado (falado e escrito).


Competências Pessoais

  • Mantenha a calma sob pressão e demonstre forte consciência situacional.
  • Comunicação clara, organização e atenção a detalhes.
  • Perfil colaborativo e compromisso com a segurança.
  • Disciplina no cumprimento de procedimentos e na elaboração de relatórios.


⚠️ Importante:
Responda às perguntas de triagem

Ao se candidatar à vaga ou ao Banco de Talentos pelo LinkedIn, lembre-se de responder todas as perguntas de triagem disponíveis no momento da aplicação . Elas são fundamentais para que possamos entender melhor seu perfil, validar certificações, idioma, experiência offshore e disponibilidade. Candidaturas sem essas informações poderão ser desconsideradas no processo de triagem inicial.


Dedique alguns minutos para preencher com atenção — isso aumentará significativamente suas chances de ser considerado(a) para futuras oportunidades offshore.

title: High School Social Emotional Counselor
description:
EARJ is looking for two experienced and accomplished Upper School Social Emotional Counselors to join our team for July 2025 — one for the Barra campus and the other for the Gávea campus. The ideal candidate is:

  • A skillful practitioner in multilingual classrooms.
  • A motivated learner who accepts responsibility for their own growth.
  • Someone who thrives in an atmosphere of transformational leadership.
  • Passionate about learning and skilled in high-impact 21st-century instruction.

If you feel that you are culturally open-minded and have an optimistic growth mindset, then EARJ is the place where you can make a difference. Contribute to a community that is inclusive, culturally sensitive, and equitable, and in which everyone experiences a strong sense of belonging.

  • Comissionamento de sistemas e instalações prediais gerais em empreendimento de grande porte;
  • Acompanhamento de obras de instalações prediais, desde a execução de infraestrutura, instalação de equipamentos e realização de testes dos sistemas prediais;
  • Realização de testes funcionais e integrados dos diversos sistemas predais (elétrica, hidráulica, incêndio, ar condicionado e ventilação mecânica, automação predial, segurança eletrônica e redes de comunicações);
  • Engenheiro Elétrico, Mecânico, Mecatrônico, Civil ou afins;
  • Experiência em leitura e compreensão plena de projetos elétricos, hidráulicos, incêndio, ar condicionado e ventilação mecânica, automação predial, segurança eletrônica e redes de comunicações;
  • Experiência comprovada de, no mínimo 5 (cinco) anos em serviços de comissionamento de edificações comerciais, corporativas e/ou industriais;
  • Experiência em coordenação dos serviços de comissionamento das instalações;
  • Ter conhecimento e experiência em comissionamento de sistema de ar condicionado do tipo expansão indireta e seus equipamentos (chillers, bombas, torres, fancoils, caixas VAV, ventiladores e exaustores);
  • Vale refeição ou alimentação;
  • Seguro de vida

O Centro de Tecnologia de Edificações é uma empresa de consultoria e gerenciamento especializada em qualidade, tecnologia, gestão, sustentabilidade e inovação para o setor da construção.

Exercemos nossas atividades em território nacional desde 1990, desenvolvendo metodologias e tecnologias para a melhoria da gestão das empresas, dos empreendimentos e das obras, estimulando e promovendo a produtividade, a competitividade, a cultura diferenciada e o crescimento sustentável da cadeia produtiva da construção.

title: Principal Umbilicals Engineer
description:
Select how often (in days) to receive an alert:

TechnipFMC is committed to driving real change in the energy industry. Our ambition is to build a sustainable future through relentless innovation and global collaboration – and we want you to be part of it. You’ll be joining a culture that values curiosity, expertise, and ideas as well as diversity, inclusion, and authenticity. Bring your unique energy to our team of more than 20,000 people worldwide, and discover a rewarding, fulfilling, and varied career that you can take in anywhere you want to go.

Job Purpose

Responsible for the technical package management on dedicated projects and mentorship across the umbilical engineering department. Responsible for the management of high impact topics across all live projects and provide technical support and guidance at a project technical leadership level with support of the lead engineer where required. Responsible for the content and quality of umbilical engineering activities including management and co-ordination of task related improvements and level 3 / level 4 obeya.

Job Description
  • At technical authority level, provide support to Post Award teams throughout the life cycle of the project. Including but not limited to supporting:

Strategy setting at project kick-off

Technical risk identification, reviews, communication to PMA and closure

Design rule and project concessions

Approval status of for any umbilical engineering assessment within design rule limits and umbilical cross section designs.

  • Management and close out of technical topics and work with other leads to ensure balance and support across the wider department.
  • Responsible for development and integration of new technologies, templates, calculations and tools to improve efficiency and quality.
  • On job training and mentorship of engineers at all levels within the PMA.
  • Working with Pre-award team, ensure a smooth handover of tender and feed projects to contract award.
  • Drive Company initiatives with the umbilical team in conjunction with other leads and Post Award Engineering Manager
  • Where appropriate and as directed, take actions to comply with the group expectations to meet the code of experts’ requirement.
You are meant for this job if:
  • Degree or equivalent in an Engineering discipline – preferably Mechanical Engineering, Subsea Engineering.
  • Relevant experience of the offshore industry and in the detailed design of umbilical systems orengineering background with experience of the offshore industry and in the detailed design of umbilical systems. Or general engineering background with relevant experience of the offshore industry and in the detailed design of umbilical systems.
  • Vast knowledge of industry standards relating to umbilical design and subsea industry.
  • Significant experience problem solving and working in high pace environments
  • Proficient in software such as Orcaflex
  • Proficient in Microsoft office tool such as word, excel and PowerPoint
  • Experience delivering against challenging schedules in a project management environment is essential.
  • Experience within Dynamic Inter-Array Cables
  • Experience leading a team and effective workload management
  • Experience with engineering tool such as MathCAD or equivalent.
  • Experience in design tool is not required but beneficial, such as:
    AutoCAD, Inventor
  • Experience in Finite Element Analysis Tools is not required but beneficial, such as:
    Ansys, Abaqus, Orcaflex.
  • Experience with Lean practices and has a drive for improvements
  • Experience with Design for Safety and high quality practices
What we offer
  • My Annual Leave - 25days + 8fixed public holidays.
  • My Wealth and Protection – Critical Illness Cover, Income Protection, Life Assurance, Will Writing, Workplace Isa, Group Personal Pension Plan - employer contributions up to 10%.
  • My Health and Wellbeing - Private Medical Insurance, Employee Assistance Programme, Dental Insurance, Health Assessments & Personal Accident Insurance.
  • My Lifestyle - Electric Vehicle Scheme, Cyle2Work, Employee Tech Scheme, Give as You Earn, GymFlex, Holiday Trading, Personal Travel Insurance, Perks at Work.
  • My Workplace - Subsidised Cafe, Branded workwear, Hybrid Working, Flexible Working Arrangements, Enhanced Maternity and Parental leave, Talent/Management and Leadership programmes, Various inhouse training opportunities for your personal development.
  • My Giving - Volunteering opportunities

Being a global leader in the energy industry requires an inclusive and diverse environment. TechnipFMC promotes diversity, equity, and inclusion by ensuring equal opportunities to all ages, races, ethnicities, religions, sexual orientations, gender expressions, disabilities, or all other pluralities. We celebrate who you are and what you bring. Every voice matters and we encourage you to add to our culture.

TechnipFMC respects the rights and dignity of those it works with and promotes adherence to internationally recognized human rights principles for those in its value chain.

Learnmore about TechnipFMCand find other open positions by visiting ourCareer Page.

Follow us onLinkedInfor company updates.

title: Regional It Data Engineer\ Administrador De Dados De Ti
description:
Job Description

  • Data Engineer

    As a Data Engineer at Fugro, you will manage robust and scalable data infrastructure, ensur ing data quality and integrity, and optimiz e data processing and storage efficiency. The Data Engineer work s closely with other teams to meet data needs and provide security standards and regulations compliance. Additionally, they continuously seek opportunities to enhance data processes and infrastructure .

    What You Will Do

    • Requirements Gathering and Analysis:
      Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into functional requirements for data needs.

    • System Configuration and Customization:
      Configure and customize data tools and processes to meet business requirements, including setting up user interfaces, workflows, data fields, and other system settings.

    • Testing and Quality Assurance:
      Using manual and automated testing procedures, develop and execute test plans to ensure data tools and processes meet quality standards and function correctly.

    • User Support and Training:
      Support end-users by troubleshooting issues, answering questions, and providing training on how to use data tools effectively.

    • Documentation:
      Create and maintain documentation such as user manuals, technical specifications, and system diagrams to facilitate understanding and support of data processes and tools.

    • Data Analysis and Reporting:
      Analyze data collected from relevant data sources to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can inform business decisions—design customizations and data analytics queries, dashboards, displays, and reports for data analytics projects.

    • System Integration:
      Collaborate with IT teams to integrate data processing tools and processes with other systems and services within the organization's technology ecosystem.

    • Change Management:
      Manage changes to data tools and processes, including updates, enhancements, and migrations, ensuring minimal disruption to business operations.

    • Security and Compliance:
      Ensure that data tools and processes adhere to security protocols and regulatory compliance requirements, such as ISO-27001, NIST 800-171, GDPR, HIPAA, or PCI-DSS, depending on the industry.

    • Continuous Improvement:
      Identify opportunities for improvement in processes, systems, and workflows, and work with stakeholders to implement enhancements and optimizations.

    What We Are Looking For

    • 4 or more years of experience utilizing technology platforms, database utilities and reporting tools including SQL and T- SQL ;

    • E xperience working on Data warehouse, ETL and integrations, as well as data modeling workflows ;

    • General knowledge and understanding of IT acumen associated to best practice ITIL standards including User Technical Support and Change Control ;

    • General knowledge of Cloud database administration (Azure and AWS ) ;

    • Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, Scala, and SQL ;

    • Skills in data modeling and designing data schemas ;

    • Familiarity with cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, Microsoft Fabric, and Google ;

    • At least Upper-Intermediate level of spoken and written English .

    Bonus Points

    • At least intermediate proficiency in Power Apps.

    • Previous experience extracting data from ERP systems.

    How We Work

    At Fugro, we believe in alignment, autonomy, and personal accountability throughout the product life cycle. Our collaborative work environment blends the flexibility of remote work with in-office collaboration, fostering a culture built on trust.

    About Fugro

    Fugro is the world's leading independent provider of geo-intelligence and asset integrity solutions for large construction, infrastructure, and natural resources. We collect and analyze data about the Earth and the structures built upon it, providing comprehensive information and advice to our clients to help them make better decisions about their assets and projects. We rely on innovation to push the transition towards net-zero carbon, safe infrastructure and climate resilience to deliver on our promise to create a safe and livable world.

    Why would you join us?

    International Geo-data environment - We work for and with the entire world. The Earth is fascinating, as are the people on it. We work hard to create and maintain an inclusive culture. Challenging projects and exciting opportunities - We are ahead of the curve and have the best projects to work on. In addition, exciting opportunities arise around the world every day. Freedom to grow faster - If you are prepared to take the initiative, ample opportunities locally or worldwide await you at Fugro.

Disclaimer for recruitment agencies:

Fugro does not accept any unsolicited applications from recruitment agencies. Acquisition to Fugro Recruitment or any Fugro employee is not appreciated .

About the Role

NinjaOne is scaling rapidly, and we’re seeking a seasonedTableau Analyst to collaborate across global teams and drive accelerated business growth. Reporting to the VP Global Sales Operations, you will spearhead crafting user-friendly Tableau dashboards & reports to help provide actionable insights & drive business growth.

Advanced proficiency in Tableau will be indispensable, enabling you to create visually compelling dashboards & reports for our team. If you thrive in dynamic, fast-paced environments, embrace complexity, and excel as a persuasive data storyteller, this role is tailored for you.

English Resume Required.

Location :
Remote, but must be located in the Philippines, Mexico, Ecuador, Colombia, or Brazil.

  • Philippine working hours:

    00 PM to midnight (PHT UTC+8) In office 1-2 days a week.

    00 AM to 6:

What You’ll be Doing

  • Develop, implement, and maintain Tableau data models, dashboards, and reports.

About Us

NinjaOne automates the hardest parts of IT to deliver visibility, security, and control over all endpoints for more than 20,000 customers. title: Pesquisador(A) De Desenvolvimento Analítico Nível Sênior - Divisão De Farmacêuticos Estabelecid...
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION:

Pesquisador(a) de Desenvolvimento Analítico Nível Sênior

Sobre a Abbott

A Abbott é líder global em saúde, desenvolvendo ciência inovadora para melhorar a saúde das pessoas. Estamos sempre antecipando mudanças na ciência e tecnologias médicas.

Trabalhando na Abbott

Na Abbott, você pode realizar um trabalho importante, crescer e aprender, cuidar de si mesmo e de sua família, ser você mesmo e viver de maneira plena. Você terá acesso a:

  • Desenvolvimento de carreira em uma empresa internacional onde é possível crescer na carreira dos seus sonhos.
  • Reconhecimento mundial como um ótimo lugar para trabalhar, presente em dezenas de países, e uma das empresas mais admiradas do mundo pela revista Fortune.
  • Reconhecimento como uma das melhores grandes empresas para se trabalhar, incluindo categorias de diversidade, mães que trabalham, executivas e cientistas.
A oportunidade

Esta posição tem local de trabalho no Rio de Janeiro, no negócio de Medicamentos de Marca e Produtos Farmacêuticos. Nosso compromisso é fornecer benefícios de medicamentos de confiança para países em rápido crescimento e desenvolvimento. Nosso portfólio inclui medicamentos de alta qualidade em áreas terapêuticas como gastroenterologia, saúde feminina, cardiometabólico, sistema nervoso central, respiratório, saúde do consumidor e vacina contra a gripe.

Responsabilidades
  • Cumprir normas de boas práticas de laboratório.
  • Elaborar e atualizar especificações técnicas e métodos de análise de matérias-primas e produtos acabados.
  • Avaliar documentos de fornecedores, monitorar recursos analíticos e elaborar relatórios técnicos.
  • Desenvolver e orientar no desenvolvimento de métodos de análise de insumos e produtos formulados.
  • Validar e orientar na validação de métodos de análise de insumos e produtos.
  • Analisar e orientar atividades de análise de insumos, amostras de pré-formulações, lotes piloto, produtos acabados e produtos em estabilidade.
  • Dar suporte técnico ao controle de qualidade, interno e externo, na transferência de novos métodos analíticos.
  • Realizar pesquisas bibliográficas e ser responsável pela etapa analítica dos projetos designados.
  • Realizar estudos e perfis de degradação de matéria-prima e do produto acabado.
  • Desenvolver e avaliar métodos discriminativos de perfis de dissolução comparativos.
  • Desenvolver e validar métodos de validação de limpeza.
  • Elaborar documentação técnica para submissão de novos registros, em parceria com os departamentos Regulatório e Desenvolvimento Galênico, atendendo à legislação vigente.
  • Avaliar criticamente os resultados analíticos obtidos.
  • Garantir a padronização das atividades através da elaboração e revisão dos Procedimentos Operacionais (OPs).
  • Contribuir para que a área Analítica esteja sempre de acordo com as normas de GMP e EHS.
  • Conhecer os riscos potenciais nas novas atividades antes do início do trabalho.
  • Participar de estudos de viabilidade de projetos e avaliação técnica-regulatória de documentos de registro de novos medicamentos.
  • Ter experiência com cromatografia líquida e gasosa, espectrofotometria UV/VIS e IR.
  • Ter experiência com desenvolvimento e validação de métodos analíticos, estudos de estabilidade e de degradação forçada.
  • Possuir conhecimentos sólidos em legislações de analítica.
  • Experiência com validação de limpeza e desenvolvimento de métodos de perfil de dissolução.
Qualificações necessárias
  • Formação universitária em Farmácia, Química ou Engenharia Química.
  • Sólida experiência na função.
Candidate-se agora

Siga suas aspirações de carreira na Abbott, uma empresa que pode ajudar você a construir seu futuro e viver da melhor maneira possível. A Abbott oferece oportunidades iguais e é comprometida com a diversidade de colaboradores.

Conecte-se conosco em e acompanhe-nos pelo Facebook/Abbott Brasil, LinkedIn e Twitter @AbbottNews.

title: Local Technical Support
description:
Be a part of Stefanini!

At Stefanini we are more than 30,000 geniuses, connected from more than 40 countries, we co-create a better future.


Main activities and responsibilities

- As a member of the Service Delivery team, acting as a single point of contact for all incidents and service Requests for the end-users and VIP users.

- Attend all walk-ins to the IT Welcome Desk, logging and prioritizing them as tickets in the service management tool.

- Resolving and/or escalating assigned tickets within agreed SLAs. Keeping end users informed on ticket status and progress.

- Ensuring end-users are notified and updated at all times as to the status of issues, outages etc. affecting the user community.

- Performing end-user training and IT Induction for new joiners.

- Installing, configuring, testing, maintaining, monitoring, and troubleshooting all end-user devices, such as laptops, tablets, mobile phones, printers, as well as network and printers.

- Ensuring all hardware and software inventories are properly maintained and managing IT assets.

- Performing creation, modification and deletion of user accounts and groups on various systems and platforms.

- Managing access permissions on various systems and platforms.

- Contributing to the knowledge management process by creating relevant guidelines, procedures etc.

- Providing support according to shift plans when needed.

Competencies and personality

- Ability to communicate in an effective and positive manner

- Proactive in identifying issues and providing solution

- Sense of ownership, accountability and prioritization

- Quick learning skills with information retention and a good technical aptitude/ability.

- At ease at working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment

- Excellent verbal and written communication skills

- Excellent customer service skills including effective listening, patience, empathy and diplomacy

Education & Qualifications

- Hands on knowledge of Windows 10/11 and MacOS operating systems, Active Directory, Microsoft Office suite/Office365

- Knowledge of mobile technologies including mobile OS platforms (Android, IOS)

- Familiarity with video conferencing and other audio/video equipment and technologies

- Ability to perform complex troubleshooting of networked devices (laptops, tablets, mobile phones, printers etc.)

- Knowledge of industry standard service desk processes and procedures

- ITIL certification preferred

Work experience

- Minimum 3 years of IT experience, preferably in a similar support role

- Experience in providing support to senior management and VIPs


Languages

- Fluent in English and Portuguese


Technology

- Hands on knowledge of Windows 10/11 and MacOS operating systems, Active Directory, Microsoft Office suite/Office365, ServiceNow, InTune, Autopilot, SCCM, JAMF


This is a temporary project of 1 and a half year long.


Please if you are interested send your resume in english.


Regards.

title: Gerente Executivo – Service Operations & Pmo
description:
Missão do Cargo:

  • Gerência Sênior, com reporte direto ao C-Level (LATAM).
  • Responsável por sustentar todas as etapas após a assinatura do contrato (Service Delivery), garantindo a melhor experiência ao cliente durante toda a sua jornada contratual. O objetivo é estabelecer uma relação de confiança que potencialize a fidelização e ampliação dos negócios e resultados, com foco principal nas operações do Brasil (onde está concentrada a maior parte das operações), e também na Colômbia (em fase de start-up), com atuação de suporte para LATAM.


Responsabilidades do Cargo:

  • Gerenciar as Áreas de Operações de Atendimento e TI, Telecomunicações, Monitoramento dos SLAs Técnicos buscando a aderência aos resultados e entregas previstas, para contratos Brasil e Colombia.
  • Planejar manutenções e upgrades tecnológicos, garantindo alta disponibilidade da infraestrutura operacional.
  • Liderar o PMO (Program Management Office), Logística e Implantação, com foco na gestão de riscos e no sucesso do cliente.
  • Consolidar e priorizar demandas de investimentos (projetos transversais e estratégicos), otimizando os recursos disponíveis e convocando a Diretoria quando necessário.
  • Promover a melhoria contínua dos processos, com foco em aumento de produtividade e redução de custos.
  • Apoiar as áreas Comerciais e de Pré-Vendas na identificação de novas oportunidades de negócio.
  • Compartilhar com Pré-Vendas e Comercial informações relevantes sobre lições aprendidas, custos operacionais e demais dados úteis à construção de propostas.


Experiência Prévia Necessária:

  • Experiência sólida em gestão de operações de serviço e atendimento ao cliente, incluindo monitoramento de indicadores de desempenho (KPIs) e ambientes de alta disponibilidade.
  • Vivência em gestão de áreas de infraestrutura de telecomunicações de grande porte (Satélite, Datacenters, Backhaul).
  • Habilidade na gestão de fornecedores de campo (Field Service) e prestadores de serviços técnicos.
  • Atuação comprovada em PMO, gestão de CAPEX / OPEX e processos de planejamento.
  • Diferencial:
    experiência em operações ou projetos em empresas dos segmentos de Satélite, Operadoras de Telecom, Utilities, Oil & Gás, ou Marítimo.


Formação:

Graduação completa em Engenharia de Telecomunicações, Elétrica, Produção ou áreas correlatas.

Idiomas

Inglês:
Avançado / Fluente (obrigatório).

Espanhol:
Desejável / Preferencial (não obrigatório).


Perfil do Profissional:

  • Liderança de equipes multidisciplinares, com forte organização, dinamismo, senso de urgência e visão de dono.
  • Excelente relacionamento interpessoal;
    habilidade para construir parcerias com clientes, parceiros e outras áreas internas.
  • Capacidade de gestão de conflitos e orientação para resultados.
  • Habilidade de comunicação e apresentações executivas, especialmente em interações com a alta liderança.
  • Domínio de Excel e PowerPoint.
  • Diferenciais:
    conhecimento em Power Query, Power BI e implantação de tecnologias voltadas ao aumento da produtividade.



Declaração de Igualdade de Oportunidades:

Comprometemo-nos com a diversidade e inclusão em nosso local de trabalho.

title: Analista De Integridade Júnior
description:
A Aegea

Criada em 2010, a Aegea é líder no setor privado de saneamento básico no Brasil. Em cada município onde atua, leva mais saúde e qualidade de vida para a população, respeitando sempre o meio ambiente e a cultura local.


Programa Respeito dá o Tom

O programa nasceu com a meta de espelhar a demografia da população brasileira no quadro de funcionários da empresa.

Em 2022 a Aegea emitiu um título sustentável atrelado a metas que incluem alcançar 45% de mulheres e 27% de negros em cargos de liderança até 2030, sendo pioneira em se comprometer com meta de diversidade racial em cargos de liderança.


A Aegea tem o compromisso com a promoção de um ambiente de trabalho mais igualitário, diverso e inclusivo, e estimula o respeito e a valorização das diferenças.

Aqui, todos os candidatos qualificados serão considerados no processo seletivo, independentemente de raça, gênero, orientação sexual, religião, naturalidade, nacionalidade, deficiência, idade ou outras características.


Responsabilidades e atribuições

  • Boa comunicação para efetuar treinamentos e operacionalizar o plano de comunicação e treinamento da área;
  • Realizar apresentações da área de Integridade, de modo a disseminar a cultura e procedimentos de Compliance aos colaboradores da companhia;
  • Apoiar nas análises de processos de integridade, tais como formulários de conflitos de interesse e exposição política;
  • Participar de processos de due diligence dos fornecedores da área;
  • Apoiar na implantação dos pilares de Compliance e no controle do plano de ação da área;
  • Prestar suportena elaboração de relatórios, planilhas e gráficos, compilando dados para acompanhamento da área.


Requisitos:

  • Superior em andamento ou completo em Direito, Administração de Empresas e/ou áreas correlatas;
  • Perfil analítico com boas habilidades comunicativas e de relacionamento interpessoal;
  • Experiência generalista com processos de Integridade;
  • Habilidades em Excel e PowerPoint (procv, tabelas dinâmicas, criação de painéis e gráficos).
  • Residir no Rio de Janeiro/RJ.
  • Disponibilidade para viagens 2x por mês nas unidades do grupo Aegea.

description:

Somos uma das 10 maiores empresas em prestação de serviços, reconhecidos pela nossa excelência e capacidade de fornecer uma experiência única aos nossos clientes e equipes. Requisitos e qualificações:


  • Ensino superior cursando ou completo em Administração, Contabilidade, Economia ou áreas correlatas;
  • Conhecimento emExcel (nível intermediário é um diferencial);
  • Desejável experiência prévia na área financeira;
  • Organização, atenção aos detalhes e boa comunicação.


Benefícios

  • Convênio com o SESC;
  • Vale Refeição;
  • Vale Transporte;
  • Assistência Médica;
  • Assistência Odontológica;
  • Seguro de vida


Estamos comprometidos com a diversidade e a inclusão, e por isso esta oportunidade é destinada exclusivamente a Pessoas com Deficiência (PCD) .


Buscamos um(a) profissional comprometido(a), organizado(a) e com vontade de crescer, para atuar em nossa equipe contábil, contribuindo com as rotinas da área e com a melhoria contínua dos nossos processos.

Olá, pessoa genial! Você está no nosso Banco de Talentos da área de Comercial!
Somos uma Startup (Edtech) em crescimento, então aqui o aprendizado é constante e você terá pista livre para decolar e, claro, MUITOS desafios! Além disso, você trabalhará ao lado de pessoas diversas e talentosas que irão te auxiliar a maximizar todo o seu potencial de gerar o maior impacto positivo possível!
Sonhamos alto e apostamos no potencial das nossas pessoas , acreditando que cada um tem um papel fundamental na nossa jornada e no alcance dos nossos objetivos. Temos o compromisso de ser uma empresa onde todos tenham a oportunidade de exercer desenvolvimento pessoal e profissional . Nosso dia a dia é movido por uma cultura inspiradora e inclusiva , que busca a equidade e valoriza as diferenças. Por isso, buscamos pessoas cada vez mais diversas e inovadoras para fazer parte desse propósito!
Se você também sonha alto (ao infinito e além!), tem paixão no que faz, tem garra (cai mas levanta!), trabalha com transparência , e quer um ambiente de trabalho onde você tenha a oportunidade de evoluir constantemente , a Jovens Gênios é o seu lugar!
Aqui, temos as melhores pessoas e todas se unem pelo mesmo propósito:
transformar a educação mundial através da tecnologia e democratização de acesso.
Como Será o Seu Dia a Dia

title: Inspetor Ex / Engenheiro Eletricista
description:
Qiji Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

Inspetor Ex / Engenheiro Eletricista

Qiji Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

Cargo :
Inspetor Ex / Engenheiro Eletricista

Duração estimada :
Projeto temporário – aproximadamente 6 meses

Responsabilidades :

  • Seguir as Diretrizes de Segurança Elétrica do Grupo ES49985 e TEZ49001.
  • Garantir a conformidade com os requisitos de instalação e inspeção das normas IEC60079-14 e 17.
  • Inspecionar e verificar o registro Ex e os certificados Ex com base na documentação do Projeto.
  • Realizar supervisão durante a instalação de equipamentos certificados Ex para assegurar uma instalação correta e em conformidade.
  • Seguir o Plano de Garantia de Integridade Ex do Projeto e verificar a conformidade com a norma IEC60079.
  • Revisar e validar os Registros de Inspeção e Teste da Construção Elétrica Ex (EITRs), garantindo que as falhas sejam registradas e corrigidas conforme os padrões da IEC60079.
  • Colaborar com o Inspetor Líder Ex Elétrico do Grupo / Gerente de Segurança em questões, dúvidas e preocupações relacionadas à segurança elétrica.

Competência Elétrica no Projeto:

  • Apoiar o desenvolvimento do Registro Ex e garantir a documentação precisa dos equipamentos Ex instalados, em conjunto com o Inspetor Líder Ex.
  • Fornecer supervisão e orientação ao pessoal de instalação Ex para garantir a conformidade com a norma IEC60079.
  • Garantir o cumprimento do Plano de Garantia de Integridade Ex do Projeto, em coordenação com o Inspetor Líder Ex / Supervisor.
  • Inspecionar e verificar a instalação e a inspeção final Ex após o comissionamento, para manter a conformidade com a norma IEC60079.
  • Preencher e revisar os EITRs (Registros de Inspeção e Teste Elétricos), garantindo precisão e conformidade.
  • Colaborar com o grupo de comissionamento para finalizar e aprovar os Registros de Inspeção e Teste (ITRs).
  • Documentar os motivos de não conformidade quando a instalação não atender aos requisitos;
    garantir a conclusão dapunch list antes de encerrar os EITRs.
  • Auxiliar na preparação e verificação da punch list dos EITRs, confirmando os itens concluídos.

Requisitos :

  • Treinamento CompEx em Áreas Classificadas conforme IEC60079-14 e 17 é obrigatório, devendo estar concluído e com certificado válido (Ex01–Ex04).
  • Treinamento CompEx concluído e estar qualificado há pelo menos 3 anos, podendo comprovar experiência prévia.
  • Técnico Eletricista com curso de Aprendizagem Elétrica completo, no mínimo até o nível ONC / HNC, ou NVQ Nível 3, ou equivalente reconhecido em Engenharia de Instalação e Manutenção Elétrica.
  • Excelente conhecimento prático sobre Permissão de Trabalho, procedimentos de Isolamento Elétrico e Avaliação de Riscos.
  • Experiência em inspeção. Excelente inglês, falado e escrito. Outros idiomas relevantes também são desejáveis.

O que oferecemos :

  • Oportunidade de atuaçãono setor de óleo e gás;
  • Ambiente técnico e colaborativo.

title: Openstack Engineering Manager
description:
Join or sign in to find your next job

Join to apply for the OpenStack Engineering Manager role at Canonical

1 week ago Be among the first 25 applicants

Join to apply for the OpenStack Engineering Manager role at Canonical

Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.
We are hiring an Engineering Manager ...
This role is an opportunity for a technologist with a passion for Linux and Cloud technologies to build a career with Canonical and drive the success with those leveraging Ubuntu and open source products. If you have an affinity for open source development and a passion for technology, then you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.
The BootStack team designs, builds, and operates modern distributed systems on private infrastructure for customers. From Kubernetes to OpenStack and everything in-between, you'll be working with the latest technology in a fast-paced engineering environment. As a Cloud Engineering Manager for the BootStack team, you will be responsible for managing the engineers that oversee day-to-day Managed Service of customer environments, including customer service management, managed services operations and consistent product improvement engineering. Collaboration with customers, product engineering, and operations is critical to success.
Location:
This is a globally remote role.
The role entails

  • Manage a growing engineering team to optimise the quality and velocity of both development and operations
  • Identify and measure team health indicators
  • Implement disciplined engineering and operations processes
  • Represent the BootStack team with respect to stakeholders, customers, and external teams
  • Ensure proper team focus on priorities, milestones, and deliverables
  • Work to meet service level agreements with customer deployments around the globe
  • Deliver quality managed services in a consistent, timely manner
What we are looking for in you
  • Bachelors (or equivalent) education in a technology field
  • Proven track record of professional experience of either software delivery using Python, Go, C, C++, Java, or similar and/or managing operations teams
  • Proven experience with OpenStack
  • Demonstrated strong commitment to testing methodologies and maintainable code quality
  • Experience with Linux system administration, Ubuntu/Debian a plus
  • Strong communication and cooperation skills
  • Experience with agile software development methodologies
  • Experience working in and managing distributed teams
  • Technical aptitude for understanding complex distributed systems
  • Experience with cloud topologies and technologies
  • Travel to team and company events and customer meetings, roughly 20% or less
What we offer colleagues
We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
  • Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
  • Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
  • Annual compensation review
  • Recognition rewards
  • Annual holiday leave
  • Maternity and paternity leave
  • Team Member Assistance Program & Wellness Platform
  • Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
  • Priority Pass and travel upgrades for long-haul company events
About Canonical
Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence;
in order to succeed, weneed to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

  • Seniority levelMid-Senior level

  • Employment typeFull-time

  • Job functionEngineering and Information Technology
  • IndustriesSoftware Development

title: Engineering Manager, Back End (Bangkok Based, Relocation Provided)
description:
Engineering Manager, Back End (Bangkok based, relocation provided)

Join to apply for the Engineering Manager, Back End (Bangkok based, relocation provided) role at Agoda

Engineering Manager, Back End (Bangkok based, relocation provided)

1 week ago Be among the first 25 applicants

Join to apply for the Engineering Manager, Back End (Bangkok based, relocation provided) role at Agoda

About Agoda
Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

About Agoda
Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
Our Purpose – Bridging the World Through Travel
We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
Get to Know our Team:
In Agoda’s Back End Engineering department, we build the scalable, fault-tolerant systems and APIs that host our core business logic. Our systems cover all major areas of our business:
inventory and pricing, product information, customer data, communications, partner data, booking systems, payments, and more. These mission-critical systems change frequently with dozens of releases per day, so we must employ state-of-the-art CI/CD and testing techniques in order to make sure everything works without any downtime. We also ensure that our systems are self-healing, responding gracefully to extreme loads or unexpected input. In order to accomplish this, we use state-of-the-art languages like Scala and Go, data technologies like Kafka and Aerospike, and agile development practices. Most importantly though, we hire great people from all around the world and empower them to be successful. Whether it’s building new projects like Flights and Packages or reimagining our existing business, you’ll make a big impact as part of the Back End Engineering team.
The Opportunity:
The Engineering Manager role at Agoda is one of the most significant and challenging roles at the company. The right candidate is both extremely hands on – technically excellent, with solid engineering principles – and exhibits strong leadership and people development skills. We are looking for world class development managers to lead one or more of our engineering teams.
In this Role, you’ll get to:

  • Be hands on – its one of the job’s fundamental task, and most of our development managers are writing and reviewing code, giving expert level coaching and guidance to their engineers.
  • It’s important to have a love of engineering and a passion for building things elegantly and at scale. Staying in touch with where the industry is going is crucial, and it’s important to have strong opinions about how systems should be architected, engineered, and maintained
  • Do full stack engineering:
    you should have solid experience in all parts of the technology stack:
    infrastructure, client side, back end, performance, data, and others.
  • Developing people – Despite our investment and belief in technology, people are still our greatest asset. The right candidate will have a keen interest in developing people:
    inspiring those around them so they can achieve their potential. Being able to bring A-players such as yourself from outside and integrating them into the business will also be important.
What you’ll Need to Succeed :
  • Extremely proficient in at least 1 programming language (Java, Scala, C#)
  • Strong experience in systems architecture – particularly in complex, scalable and fault tolerant distributed systems
  • Demonstrable experience as a system owner with operational responsibility
  • Proficient in lower level engineering (Garbage collection, context switching, threading)
  • DevOps culture – Agility. Leanness. Automation. CI/CD
  • Good understanding of application security
  • Passionate about technology and the Internet
  • Must have worked in a successful agile development team
  • Must have run engineering teams before with 5+ direct reports
  • Able to operate with autonomously:
    making decisions, setting KPIs, with a strong sense of ownership
  • Practices data driven decision making
It’s Great if you have:
  • Proficiency in more than one programming language

Equal Opportunity Employer
At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.
We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .
Disclaimer
We do not accept any terms or conditions, nor do we recognize any agency’s representation of a candidate, from unsolicited third-party or agency submissions. If we receive unsolicited or speculative CVs, we reserve the right to contact and hire the candidate directly without any obligation to pay a recruitment fee.

title: Executivo Comercial - Picpay Negócios (Rio De Janeiro)
description:
Sobre o PicPay
Com mais de dez anos de história, o PicPay é um ecossistema completo de serviços financeiros e não-financeiros que tem como objetivo atender as necessidades diárias de milhares de pessoas e negócios, tornando-se a sua principal conta do dia a dia.
Fundada em Vitória (ES), a empresa já conta com mais de 35 milhões de clientes ativos e faz parte do grupo J&F, um dos maiores conglomerados empresariais do Brasil. A companhia atua em diversas frentes, como Serviços Financeiros para Pessoa Física, Serviços Financeiros para Pessoa Jurídica, Investimentos e PicPay Shop.
Pautados pela nossa cultura, seguimos no propósito de dar muito mais pique para a vida de milhões de brasileiros. Conheça nossos valores:
Atitude de Dono(a), Disciplina, Determinação, Disponibilidade, Simplicidade, Humildade e Franqueza.
O respeito, a ética, a busca pela equidade e a valorização da pluralidade são elementos inegociáveis e fazem parte da prática no nosso dia a dia aqui no PicPay. Por isso, esta vaga está aberta para todas as pessoas, independente de gênero, religião, etnia, deficiência, idade, orientação sexual ou qualquer outro fator.
Conheça melhor a unidade de negócio que essa vaga pertence:
Nossa unidade PicPay Negócios, tem a missão de simplificar a vida de "quem vende alguma coisa". Da grande empresa ao pequeno empreendedor. Por aqui, você fará parte da construção e desenvolvimento de produtos e serviços que simplificam a vida de milhões de brasileiros e empresas.
Responsabilidade e atribuições:
  • Prospecção de novos clientes para o PicPay;
  • Gestão de Carteira de clientes para rentabilização através de venda de produtos e serviços;
  • Desenvolver a aceitação do PicPay na praça, sinalizando os parceiros com nossa marca e fidelizando os mesmos, com nossos produtos e serviços;
  • Atingimento de Metas;
  • Gestão de Carteira.
  • Atuação no Rio de Janeiro
Requisitos e qualificações:
  • Formação completa.
  • Experiência em atendimento PaP;
  • Experiência em meios de pagamentos;
  • Experiencia na área comercial prospecções tipo PaP, relacionamento com os clientes com perfil Varejo;
  • Pacote office intermediário.
O que oferecemos:
Saúde e Bem-estar

Alimentação/ Mobilidade ou Teletrabalho:
  • Cartão de crédito PicPay Benefícios, com ampla aceitação, onde você recebe seu saldo de Alimentação/Refeição e Mobilidade ou Teletrabalho (de acordo com o seu contrato de trabalho).
Licença Paternidade e Maternidade:

title: Engenheiro De Planejamento E Controle
description:
Sobre nós:

Investimos em ativos energéticos com presença em toda a cadeia de gás natural, biometano, energia elétrica renovável e vapor através de biomassa. Oferecemos soluções energéticas para negócios que almejam uma economia de baixo carbono, proporcionando estabilidade e valor sustentável a longo prazo.

Conheça um pouco da nossa empresa em

Queremos sempre fazer mais e melhor, com segurança e com pessoas engajadas que não desistem dos desafios. Chegamos até aqui com muito esforço e trabalho em equipe. Dedicamos nossa energia para desenvolver negócios sustentáveis. Agimos como donos e estimulamos a inovação.

Buscamos criar um ambiente inclusivo, justo, seguro e respeitoso para todos, onde cada colaborador tenha acesso às mesmas oportunidades de desenvolvimento. Em nossa Companhia, não aceitamos discriminação ou preconceito, sejam eles de gênero, orientação sexual, etnia, raça, nacionalidade, condição física ou quaisquer outros. Valorizamos nossa gente, nossa diversidade, fortalecendo o time. Criamos espaços para autenticidade.

Sobre a vaga:

ENGENHEIRO DE PLANEJAMENTO E CONTROLE

PRINCIPAIS RESPONSABILIDADES:

  • Desenvolver cronogramas (Gantt, PERT/CPM) e acompanhar o progresso físico do projeto, propondo ações corretivas;
  • Coordenar equipes multidisciplinares (engenharia, construção, operações) para garantir o cumprimento de prazos e metas;
  • Elaborar projeções de custos, fluxos de caixa e análise de rentabilidade (VPL, TIR, payback );
  • Monitorar desvios financeiros e propor ações corretivas;
  • Realizar integração entre o planejamento físico e financeiro (EVM - Earned Value Management );
  • Controlar o escopo do projeto;
  • Identificar riscos técnicos, regulatórios e financeiros em projetos de gás natural e biometano.

REQUISITOS:

  • Superior completo em Engenharia de Produção, Mecânica ou áreas afins;
  • Certificação PMP ou Scrum Master;
  • Experiência em desenvolvimento de projetos industriais;
  • Experiência no segmento de midstream degás natural será um diferencial;
  • Conhecimento daMetodologia FEL, Metodologia do PMI, SAP, MS Project e Power BI.

HABILIDADES E COMPETÊNCIAS:

  • Dinamismo, organização e foco em resultados;
  • Boa comunicaçãoverbal e escrita;
  • Liderança de processos;
  • Trabalho em equipe;
  • Bom relacionamento interpessoal;
  • Gestão de tempo/ atenção à prazos.
  • Energia para realizar e contribuir com o time no alcance das metas.

title: Staff Site Reliability Engineer - Work From Home
description:
Staff Site Reliability Engineer - Work from homeStaff Site Reliability Engineer - Work from home

1 week ago Be among the first 25 applicants

Get AI-powered advice on this job and more exclusive features.

Join our close-knit LATAM remote team:
Connect through fun activities like coffee breaks, tech talks, and games with your team-mates and management.

Say goodbye to micromanagement! We champion autonomy, open communication, and respect for diversity as our core values.

️Your well-being matters:
 Our People Care team is here from day one to support you with everything from time-off requests to wellness check-ins.

Plus, our Accounts Management team ensures smooth, effective client relationships, so you can focus on what you do best.

Ready to grow with us?

Here’s what we offer you by joining us!

Competitive USD salary – We value your skills and contributions!

100% remote work – While you can work from anywhere, you’re always welcome to connect with teammates and grow your network at our coworking spaces across LATAM!

Paid time off – Take the time you need according to your country’s regulations, all while receiving your full salary. Rest, recharge, and come back stronger!

National Holidays celebrated – Take time off to celebrate important events and traditions with loved ones, fully embracing your culture.

Sick leave – Focus on your health without the stress. Take the necessary time to recover and feel better.

Refundable Annual Credit – Spend it on the perks you love to enhance your work-life balance!

Team-building activities – Join us for coffee breaks, tech talks, and after-work gatherings to bond with your Nearsure family and feel part of our vibrant community.

Birthday day off – Enjoy an extra day off during your birthday week to celebrate in style with friends and family!

About the project:

As a Staff Site Reliability Engineer , you will own and optimize OpenTelemetry pipelines, enabling scalable and efficient observability. You’ll build tools that empower teams, support incident response, and drive best practices. Your work ensures a reliable, secure infrastructure and actionable alerting across the organization.

How your day-to-day work will look like

Design, implement, and maintain observability pipelines across the three main signals—logs, metrics, and traces—ensuring standardized, scalable, and efficient data ingestion. Optimize ingestion strategies to balance cost, performance, and usability.

Build self-service automation and tooling that enables development teams to instrument and leverage observability without requiring manual intervention from the SRE team. Drive adoption of best practices while ensuring teams own their telemetry.

Design the processes, playbooks, checklists, and automations for them and other engineers to follow during an incident.

Interact with members from almost all teams across the business to understand their monitoring, alerting, and SLO / SLA requirements and design systems and processes that ensure we meet or exceed these requirements. Influence architectural decisions during initial design stages to ensure resiliency and scale at the outset of software development.

Design the processes, playbooks, checklists, and automations for them and other engineers to follow during an incident.

Leverage Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) to provision and manage monitoring tools, alerting rules, and our observability configurations across OTEL Pipelines.

Design base-level requirements for new and existing services to ensure that all client infrastructure and code are monitored consistently and accurately at a basic level.

Take full ownership of client infrastructure reliability, ensuring adherence to key availability and security KPIs.

This would make you the ideal candidate

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.

8+ Years of experience working as an SRE Engineer or in a very similar role, more focused on observability.

5+ Years of experience working with cloud (AWS).

5+ Years of experience working with IaC tools (Terraform) and GitOps CI/CD solutions (ArgoCD, GitHub Actions, or similar).

4+ Years of experience working with monitoring and logging tools such as Grafana, Prometheus, Loki, New Relic, or Datadog (experience managing observability pipelines at scale in high-throughput environments).

4+ Years of experience working in Kubernetes, including its core components, deployment methodologies, and monitoring best practices.

Strong communication skills with team members and stakeholders (technical and nontechnical communication).

Strong scripting abilities (Python, Go, or similar) for automating observability tasks.

Experience integrating incident management platforms (PagerDuty, Jira) with automated alerting workflows.

Advanced English Level is required for this role as you will work with US clients. Effective communication in English is essential to deliver the best solutions to our clients and expand your horizons.

What to expect from our hiring process

1. Let’s chat about your experience!

2. Impress our recruiters, and you’ll move on to a technical interview with our top developers.

3. Nail that, and you’ll meet our client - your final step to joining our amazing team!

At Nearsure, we’re dedicated to solving complex business challenges through cutting-edge technology and we believe in the power of tailored solutions. Whether you are passionate about transforming businesses with Generative AI, building innovative software products, or implementing comprehensive enterprise platform solutions, we invite you to be part of our dynamic team!

We would love to hear from you if you are eager to make an impact and join a collaborative team that values creativity and expertise.

Let’s work together to shape the future of technology!

By applying to this position, you authorize Nearsure to collect, store, transfer, and process your personal data in accordance with our Privacy Policy. For more information, please review our Privacy Policy. ( />//

description:

Join to apply for the Engineering Manager, Managed Services role at Canonical

Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.
We are hiring an Engineering Manager ...
This role is an opportunity for a technologist with a passion for Linux and Cloud technologies to build a career with Canonical and drive the success with those leveraging Ubuntu and open source products. If you have an affinity for open source development and a passion for technology, then you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.
The BootStack team designs, builds, and operates modern distributed systems on private infrastructure for customers. From Kubernetes to OpenStack and everything in-between, you'll be working with the latest technology in a fast-paced engineering environment. As a Cloud Engineering Manager for the BootStack team, you will be responsible for managing the engineers that oversee day-to-day Managed Service of customer environments, including customer service management, managed services operations and consistent product improvement engineering. Collaboration with customers, product engineering, and operations is critical to success.
Location:
This is a globally remote role.
The role entails

  • Manage a growing engineering team to optimise the quality and velocity of both development and operations
  • Identify and measure team health indicators
  • Implement disciplined engineering and operations processes
  • Represent the BootStack team with respect to stakeholders, customers, and external teams
  • Ensure proper team focus on priorities, milestones, and deliverables
  • Work to meet service level agreements with customer deployments around the globe
  • Deliver quality managed services in a consistent, timely manner
What we are looking for in you
  • Bachelors (or equivalent) education in a technology field
  • Proven track record of professional experience of either software delivery using Python, Go, C, C++, Java, or similar and/or managing operations teams
  • Proven experience with OpenStack
  • Demonstrated strong commitment to testing methodologies and maintainable code quality
  • Experience with Linux system administration, Ubuntu/Debian a plus
  • Strong communication and cooperation skills
  • Experience with agile software development methodologies
  • Experience working in and managing distributed teams
  • Technical aptitude for understanding complex distributed systems
  • Experience with cloud topologies and technologies
  • Travel to team and company events and customer meetings, roughly 20% or less
What we offer colleagues
We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
  • Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
  • Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
  • Annual compensation review
  • Recognition rewards
  • Annual holiday leave
  • Maternity and paternity leave
  • Team Member Assistance Program & Wellness Platform
  • Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
  • Priority Pass and travel upgrades for long-haul company events
About Canonical
Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence;
in order to succeed, weneed to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: R&D Engineer (Advanced Drilling Systems)
description:
R&D Engineer (Advanced Drilling Systems)R&D Engineer (Advanced Drilling Systems)

Get AI-powered advice on this job and more exclusive features.

Our client is expanding its R&D team in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, and is seeking highly motivated engineers to contribute to the development of cutting-edge drilling technologies for offshore deepwater applications. This opportunity centers on innovation, new product development, and testing—not operations or maintenance.

We are hiring across multiple disciplines to support core technology areas including downhole power generation, coiled tubing/drillstring development, subsea and high-voltage electronics, and advanced testing/integration systems. Ideal candidates will have a solid background in research and development (R&D), system design, and engineering analysis, with hands-on experience in product development for high-reliability environments.

Areas of Expertise We’re Looking For:

  • Mechanical Engineering:
     Experience in drilling motors, downhole turbines, or subsea pumps for power generation;
    coiled tubing/drillstring development;
    familiarity with manufacturing, machining, and supplier coordination.
  • Mechanical Design/Drafting:
     Proficiency in generating manufacturing drawings for complex drilling or subsea components and coordinating with manufacturers/suppliers.
  • Integration/Test Engineering:
     Engineers with a mechanical or electrical/electronics focus, experienced in downhole or subsea systems, sensor integration, test equipment design, and data acquisition.

Electrical Engineering:

  • Plasma/High-Voltage Electronics:
     High-voltage systems for plasma-based drilling. Relevant experience in military, defense, pulsed power, lasers, or nuclear sectors is a plus.
  • Subsea/Downhole Electronics:
     Development of high-power electronics and embedded systems for subsea applications.

Software/Firmware/Controls Engineering:

  • Firmware Development:
     Development and validation of high-reliability firmware for oil & gas environments.
  • Controls Engineering:
     Experience with PLC programming, real-time control systems, test equipment design, and HIL testing. Familiarity with MATLAB, dSPACE, or SPEEDGOAT is advantageous.

Key Responsibilities

  • Execute R&D projects in alignment with technical specifications, timelines, and budget
  • Design, test, and commercialize innovative drilling tools and systems for offshore use
  • Implement processes and tools that drive excellence and innovation in product development
  • Collaborate with global engineering teams, leadership, and suppliers to ensure successful integration and delivery
  • Manage technical risks and ensure compliance with HSEQ and regulatory standards
  • Produce detailed engineering documentation including drawings, calculations, and technical reports
  • Foster a culture of collaboration and innovation within the R&D team
  • Represent the company’s technical work at conferences to reinforce its position as a technology leader

Our client is growing its footprint in Brazil to address the region’s unique energy challenges. With a focus on offshore and deepwater solutions, the local team is instrumental in developing next-generation drilling systems tailored to this critical market. They work in close partnership with global collaborators and local operators to bring advanced solutions to life.

In this role, you’ll engage in transformative R&D efforts alongside teams in Brazil, Europe, and the USA—contributing to innovations across both conventional and renewable energy domains.

title: Embedded Hw Developer
description:
Select how often (in days) to receive an alert:

Embedded HW Developer (processor + FPGA)

Location:

Rio de Janeiro, BR Krakow, PL

Employment type:
Employee

Place of work:
Hybrid

Offshore/Onshore:
Onshore

TechnipFMC is committed to driving real change in the energy industry. Our ambition is to build a sustainable future through relentless innovation and global collaboration – and we want you to be part of it. You’ll be joining a culture that values curiosity, expertise, and ideas as well as diversity, inclusion, and authenticity. Bring your unique energy to our team of more than 20,000 people worldwide, and discover a rewarding, fulfilling, and varied career that you can take in anywhere you want to go.

Job Purpose

About Us:
 At TechnipFMC, within the Controls & Automation product line, we are pioneering technology platforms for the electrification of Subsea Control Systems and the advancement of renewable energy sources such as offshore wind, hydrogen, and wave energy.

Our Team :
The Electronics R&D team works across a broad spectrum of technologies, including analog electronics, FPGA, SoC, power design, safety design, motor controllers, processor design, and power line modems. These technologies are integral to various control system applications.

Your Role:
 As part of the Controls & Automation team at TechnipFMC, you will engage in the design, development, qualification, system integration, and production of new products into commissioning and field operation. Our multidisciplinary development environment includes HW, SW, system, test, mechatronics, and production engineering teams working collaboratively.

We are seeking Senior Embedded Hardware Developers with expertise in embedded systems and hardware design to join our Hardware development team.

Job Description
  • Define hardware requirements in collaboration with system architects, SW architects, product owners
  • Design and develop embedded hardware circuits, PCBAs, FPGA modules, including component selection, schematic drawing, PCB layout, and prototype building.
  • Conduct functional verification of embedded hardware circuits, PCBAs, FPGA modules, electronic sub-assemblies.
  • Collaborate with systems architects, mechanical designers, PCB layout, manufacturing, reliability, and SW engineering teams to design and develop embedded hardware products.
  • Create test and verification procedures and write test reports on functional, environmental, system operation mode, and manufacturing testing of custom embedded hardware designs.
You are meant for this job if:
  • Extended understanding of Central Processing Units, microcontrollers, embedded software and signal processing techniques
  • Advanced knowledge of VHDL and FPGA design and verification methodologies.
  • Experience of LT SPICE, MATLAB, Simulink, Python, and Intel (Altera) Quartus
  • Knowledge of C, C++, assembly language or other embedded software languages
  • Schematic design and PCB layout using ECAD tools like Altium Designer or equivalent.
  • Experience with lab instruments such as oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, network analyzers, communication analyzers, signal generators, and simulators.
  • Expertise in PCB layout for optimal component placement, reduced stray inductance/capacitance, improved manufacturability, and EMC compliance.
  • Experience in embedded hardware design optimized for DFX requirements (manufacturability and testability).
  • Understanding of EMC requirements and CE certification relevant to embedded controller design in control system applications.
  • Knowledge and experience of safety and reliability standards including IEC61508

Qualifications:

  • BSc, MSc, or PhD in electronics, automation, cybernetics, or a related engineering field.
  • 3-5 years of industrial experience in relevant embedded hardware development and industrialization.
  • Ability to approach complex problems structurally.
  • Open-minded, professional English proficiency, and adaptability to work in a multicultural environment.
  • Continuously raising standards, innovative, and solution oriented.
  • Interest in electronics is an additional advantage.

What We Offer:

  • Engaging tasks and work-life balance.
  • Flexible working arrangements.
  • Training and career development opportunities.
  • Comprehensive insurance and pension plans.
Skills

Being a global leader in the energy industry requires an inclusive and diverse environment. TechnipFMC promotes diversity, equity, and inclusion by ensuring equal opportunities to all ages, races, ethnicities, religions, sexual orientations, gender expressions, disabilities, or all other pluralities. We celebrate who you are and what you bring. Every voice matters and we encourage you to add to our culture.

TechnipFMC respects the rights and dignity of those it works with and promotes adherence to internationally recognized human rights principles for those in its value chain.

Learnmore about TechnipFMCand find other open positions by visiting ourCareer Page.

Follow us onLinkedInfor company updates.

OUR HIRING PROCESS:
  • We will review your application against our job requirements. We do not employ machine learning technologies during this phase as we believe every human deserves attention from another human. We do not think machines can evaluate your application quite like our seasoned recruiting professionals—every person is unique. We promise to give your candidacy a fair and detailed assessment.
  • We may then invite you to submit a video interview for the review of the hiring manager. This video interview is often followed by a test or short project that allows us to determine whether you will be a good fit for the team.
  • At this point, we will invite you to interview with our hiring manager and/or the interview team. Please note:
    We do not conduct interviews via text message, Telegram, etc. and we never hire anyone into our organization without having met you face-to-face (or via Zoom). You will be invited to come to a live meeting or Zoom, where you will meet our INFUSE team.
  • From there on, it’s decision time! If you are still excited to join INFUSE and we like you as much, we will have a conversation about your offer. We do not make offers without giving you the opportunity to speak with us live. After all, we consider our team members our family, and we want you to feel comfortable and welcomed.
INFUSE is committed to complying with applicable data privacy and security laws and regulations. For more information, please see our Privacy Policy
We are seeking an enthusiastic and skilled IT Client Support Engineer to be a vital part of our dynamic team. If you excel at providing top-notch technical support and enjoy collaborating with diverse teams to enhance user experience, we want to hear from you!
Key Responsibilities:
  • Provide prompt and effective Level 1 technical support to users, addressing their queries and technical issues with professionalism and empathy.
  • Efficiently log, dispatch, track, escalate, and follow up on support tickets to ensure timely resolution.
  • Maintain a high level of user satisfaction by delivering exceptional service and support.
  • Collaborate closely with various teams and departments to coordinate common tasks and improve IT Support service delivery.
  • Contribute to the knowledge base and documentation, ensuring resources are in place, accurate and up-to-date.
  • Undertake additional responsibilities as assigned to enhance the team’s performance and user experience.
Qualifications:
  • Minimum 2-3 years of experience in remote IT support or a similar role.
  • Proficient in the administration of Windows 10/11 and macOS environments.
  • Strong experience in managing Microsoft (Office) 365 services and Google Workspace.
  • Hands-on experience with Entra ID (former Azure Active Directory).
  • Familiarity with the ITIL framework and a foundational understanding of networking concepts.
  • Experience with Mobile Device Management (MDM) solutions is a plus.
  • Knowledge of modern AI tools like ChatGPT is a plus.
Personal Competencies:
  • Outstanding collaboration and communication skills that foster teamwork across diverse groups.
  • Proficient in written and spoken English (Advanced).
  • Excellent analytical abilities with a keen attention to detail.
  • Strong focus on user needs and a commitment to delivering quality service.
  • Positive attitude, flexibility, and proactive approach to problem-solving.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks effectively in a fast-paced environment while adhering to deadlines.
  • Experience working within multinational teams is desirable.

title: Engenheiro De Projetos E Planejamento
description:
Sobre nós:

Investimos em ativos energéticos com presença em toda a cadeia de gás natural, biometano, energia elétrica renovável e vapor através de biomassa. Oferecemos soluções energéticas para negócios que almejam uma economia de baixo carbono, proporcionando estabilidade e valor sustentável a longo prazo.

Conheça um pouco da nossa empresa em

Queremos sempre fazer mais e melhor, com segurança e com pessoas engajadas que não desistem dos desafios. Chegamos até aqui com muito esforço e trabalho em equipe. Dedicamos nossa energia para desenvolver negócios sustentáveis. Agimos como donos e estimulamos a inovação.

Buscamos criar um ambiente inclusivo, justo, seguro e respeitoso para todos, onde cada colaborador tenha acesso às mesmas oportunidades de desenvolvimento. Em nossa Companhia, não aceitamos discriminação ou preconceito, sejam eles de gênero, orientação sexual, etnia, raça, nacionalidade, condição física ou quaisquer outros. Valorizamos nossa gente, nossa diversidade, fortalecendo o time. Criamos espaços para autenticidade.

Investimos e operamos ativos energéticos no ciclo completo da cadeia de gás natural, biomassa, energia elétrica renovável e vapor, através de biomassa. Oferecemos soluções energéticas para negócios que almejam uma economia de baixo carbono, proporcionando estabilidade e valor sustentável a longo prazo.

Sobre a vaga:

Engenheiro de Projetos e Planejamento:

O Engenheiro de Projetos e Planejamento será responsável por dar suporte ao Gerente de Projetos, e diretamente pela gestão de tempo, custo e stakeholders do projeto.

Principais Responsabilidade:

  • Interagir e integrar as áreas de Engenharia, Aquisições, Operações e Construções para garantir o controle das entregas do projeto no âmbito físico e financeiro;
  • Criação do plano de contas e cronograma de acordo com a estrutura analítica do projeto - EAP;
  • Preparar e apresentar relatórios gerenciais, apresentações e dashboards executivos;
  • Acompanhamento do Plano de Riscos;
  • Apoio na gestãodos stakeholders e comunicação com o Cliente/Parceiro;
  • Acompanhamento junto à área de aquisições do diligenciamento dos equipamentos e materiais;
  • Reuniões periódicas internas e com os Clientes/Parceiros de acompanhamento do projeto.

Requisitos:

  • Superior completo em Engenharia;
  • Experiência em planejamento e gestão de projetos industriais de médio ou grande porte;
  • Desejável experiência nos setores de Biogás / Biometano / Gás Natural / GNL / Energia;
  • Desejável vivência de campo em obras industriais (civil e montagem eletromecânica);
  • Desejável conhecimentos de documentos de engenharia ((P&ID, projetos de base civil, BFD, PFD, diagrama unifilar);
  • Experiência avançada com o pacote MS Office (Project, Word, Excel e PowerPoint), ou Primavera;
  • Power BI será um diferencial;
  • Especialização em Gestão de Projetos será um diferencial;
  • Conhecimento dametodologia FEL (“Front-End Loading”) será um diferencial;
  • Inglês técnico.

Habilidades e Competências:

  • Comunicação escrita e verbal;
  • Bom relacionamento interpessoal;
  • Liderança de processos;
  • Visão estratégica e sistêmica.
